title:
Spin hierarchy in van der Waals molecule formation via ultracold
  three-body recombination
authors:
Jing-Lun Li, Paul S. Julienne, Johannes Hecker Denschlag, and Jos\'e
  P. D'Incao
abstract:
We theoretically investigate the product-state distribution of weakly bound
diatomic van der Waals molecules via ultracold three-body recombination of
bosonic alkali atoms. We find a two-level hierarchy of spin propensity rules at
zero magnetic field. The primary propensity rule states that nearly all
molecular products conserve the total hyperfine spin of reactant atomic pairs,
while molecular products not conserving the total spin are highly suppressed.
For the dominant molecular products, there is a secondary propensity to
conserve certain spin components of the reactant pair such as the atomic
hyperfine spins, or the total electronic or nuclear spins. The second
propensity varies across species and depends fundamentally on the interplay
between effective electronic exchange and hyperfine interactions. The spin
sensitivity of product-state distribution can potentially open up new avenues
for controlling state-to-state reaction rates in ultracold three-body
recombination.
